thread.title: Ed Sheeran Duets With Baby Spice, Says He Once Posed as Calvin Harris to Sneak Into a Party
thread.title_full: Ed Sheeran Duets With Baby Spice, Says He Once Posed as Calvin Harris to Sneak Into a Party

author: Jennifer Drysdale
title: Ed Sheeran Duets With Baby Spice, Says He Once Posed as Calvin Harris to Sneak Into a Party
text: Ed Sheeran Duets With Baby Spice, Says He Once Posed as Calvin Harris to Sneak Into a Party by Jennifer Drysdale 4:42   Ed Sheeran Duets With Baby Spice, Says He Once Posed as Calvin Harris to Sneak Into a Party Before he was the GRAMMY winning artist he is now, Ed Sheeran got by with a little help from his friends. During an interview with Shoboy and Nina on 92.3 AMP Radio, the 25-year-old singer revealed that Rita Ora once helped him sneak into a party -- by posing as her then-boyfriend, Calvin Harris! WATCH: Ed Sheeran Announces the Release Date for New Album, Sings Acoustic Version of the â€˜Fresh Princeâ€™ Theme Song "I went to an Oscars party at Madonna's manager's house by saying I was Calvin Harris," Sheeran revealed. "It was at a time when no one knew what he looked like. He was just the DJ name, and I was with my cousin and Rita Ora." "Rita Ora was with Calvin Harris at this point. She said, 'Calvin's on the list but I know he's not coming, so just say that you're him,'" he explained. While getting into the party required a little impersonating, Sheeran has no regrets. "It was a really amazing party, Prince was there actually," he said. "The first person I saw when I walked in was Prince. And apparently Calvin Harris was there, a bit shorter and a bit less Scottish, a bit less abs as well." While Sheeran has been making the rounds promoting his new album, Ã· (pronounced "Divide"), he sang a different tune during an appearance on Heart 96-107 Radio with Emma Bunton on Thursday -- performing The Spice Girls' "Goodbye" with Baby Spice herself! It was just meant to be! Could @EdSheeran be the next #GingerSpice ? ðŸ˜‚ @EmmaBunton thinks so! pic.twitter.com/sjeJou3Ptn
